name: gmagnido
text: 'what did you do'...i think i pooed a little

name: padijun
text: I remember back in 2004, netsending other people in my college classes "ENTERING DEATH MODE - WHAT DID YOU DO?" and watching them freak out from the back of the classroom.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: that. is. rad!

name: philosophe
text: I once netsent "hi" to * and got in a good deal of trouble in high school.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Net send was fun until people realised that it was me.

name: donnatron
text: can someone explain netsend? I am intrigued by this...

name: leftsaidtim
text: It's a command that sends text to people on your network. If you're in a room of people on the same LAN you could theoretically send a message to anyone which would be displayed as a pop up dialog which could appear to be an error or such as an important system message.

name: hipjiverobot
text:
Awww, the question mark, you have to leave out the question mark!

You're still awesome though.

name: mercuri0us
text: I really want a click robot.

name: sredni
text: A comment left by sredni was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, Thorfinn, nutmeg)

name: dropkickpikachu
text: Dawg she's Chinese.

name: dirtyantaeus
text: It's probably made in china but designed by the japanese. The robot, I mean. Not Ultra Peanut.

name: sredni
text: totally my bad.

name: kledermans
text: In your defense, her accent sounds more Japanese than Chinese.

text: ONSTAD'S WIFE IS CHINESE. SHE WROTE THIS STRIP.

text: This comment sounds like something Ray would say.

name: elohssa
text: This little sequence is one of my favorites.  I can't think of Ultra Peanut without saying "super-size homo jackass!"

name: divot
text: ALT TEXT: klik

name: farqussus
text: A comment left by farqussus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Deusoma, Lumus, yingkaixing)

name: deusoma
text: If I recall correctly, circa 7 months ago the alt text did not show up in the assetbar version, just the main site.

name: farqussus
text: For years I've been right-click-Properties to see alt-text. If you can't find that then you don't deserve alt-text.

name: deusoma
text: As I said, unless my memory is failing me (entirely possible), Assetbar strips did not have alt text attached to them at all . Thus: people who took the time to go to the main site, find the alt text on the proper strip, and transcribe it over here were performing a service for their fellow fans equivalent to that of Ms. Xiaomimi, who posts links to blog posts at the appropriate dates.

name: farqussus
text: I've since realised this, and have gained eight kilos due to my all-crow diet.

name: donnatron
text: That explanation makes it much less annoying! I assumed there WAS a reason, just had no idea what it was.

name: tttt
text: what did you do

name: stuart
text: I can not get my mother to use any sort of electronic device because this is always what she thinks will happen

name: bixschmix
text: Many times when my father uses electronic devices, some variant of this happens.

name: charchar
text: I did this to my Tamagochi when I was a kid;  I came back and it had a litttle space ship on the screen and i was all like, "dang."

name: ryanfuss
text: I want to know what would happen if Ultra Peanut denied Click Robot his bathroom time in panel 3? Clickle trickle perhaps?

name: theguitarhero
text:
This reminds me of this one time, ages ago, when I got one of the first Pokemon Pikachu hip odometer things.

I could have sworn I remembered hearing that they were waterproof.
